4522294D99464BBABC6AF9A68DB75D28.description:
Analyze and evaluate the methods for challenging, resisting, and changing society in
the promotion of equity, justice and equality.

D0F458AFE1124CEB8E9104F267C59F79.description:
Analyze United States foreign policy and the role of institutions and interest groups in
creating policy and evaluate their impact on the United States and the international community

F85AB61F46064873B56B81CCF42CDAB8.description:
Analyze political parties, interest and community groups, and mass media and how they
influence the beliefs and behaviors of individuals, and local, state, and national constituencies.

34DAB2F5ABE842E6B0E00D465AFE918F.description:
Examine the institutions, functions, and processes of Oregon’s state, county, local and
regional governments.

BCBEDF6F57A44221A87993C230EAC99C.description:
Evaluate the relationships among governments at the local, state, tribal, national, and
global levels.

51D42FD87F3D41C49C7CC77E9C67FF19.description:
Examine the institutions, functions, and processes of Oregon’s state, county, local and regional 
governments.

5AC83BBE963E46F68BF0E66E492F9EAE.description:
Compare and contrast the United States’ republican form of government to direct
democracy, theocracy, oligarchy, authoritarianism, and monarchy.

7FEF2F7F6E2C439CBE93288C3958A2A9.description:
Describe core elements of early governments that are evident in United States
government structure.

5A64601518E44FFD96C3D31F21A22401.description:
Identify, discuss, and explain the exclusionary language and intent of the Oregon and
U.S. Constitution and the provisions and process for the expansion and protection of civil
rights.

8A37348C80FF4F37BD20441795639273.description:
Identify and analyze the existence and perpetuation of discrimination and inequity in the
local, state, national, or global context.

55B6562E81684CB2ACFC414A161DB95C.description:
Analyze the positive and negative implications of the US Constitution, Bill of Rights and
Amendments, Supreme Court decisions, Federal Laws, and executive orders, for political, legal,
economic, and social equality for all, including traditionally marginalized groups.
